pli-tv-bu-pm:9.1: If a monk, after taking on the monks’ training and way of life, without first renouncing the training and revealing his weakness, has sexual intercourse, even with a female animal, he is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bu-pm:10.2: the sort of stealing for which kings, having caught a thief, would beat, imprison, or banish him, saying, ‘You’re a bandit, you’re a fool, you’ve gone astray, you’re a thief’
pli-tv-bu-pm:10.3: —he too is expelled and excluded from the community.
pli-tv-bu-pm:11.1: If a monk intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for him or praises death or incites someone to die, saying,
pli-tv-bu-pm:11.2: ‘My friend, what’s the point of this miserable and difficult life? Death is better for you than life!’—
pli-tv-bu-pm:11.3: thinking and intending thus, if he praises death in many ways or incites someone to die
pli-tv-bu-pm:13.8: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
